\textbf{Success Criterion}: Find suitable HDI training data for the Neural Network
\textbf{Justification}: The neural network must train on pre-calculated HDI values for certain areas\comma{} along with their respective density and average distance factors.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Retrieve OSM data for a given area using Overpass Turbo
\textbf{Justification}: This will allow me to calculate useful geographical factors to predict the HDI from instead of more human ones (which are harder to determine).

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Calculate average distance factors from a given area
\textbf{Justification}: The average distance from \textit{some object} to \textit{some other object} is also a good measure to consider. For example $A\left(\text{House}\comma{}\text{School}\right)$ is a useful factor as school children shouldn't have to travel long distances for education.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Calculate density factors from a given area
\textbf{Justification}: The number of \textit{some object} per unit area is a good way of measuring how many of that object are in a particular area while removing the bias of larger areas.
This algorithm will allow us to make predictions on the HDI given a set of factors.
This algorithm will allow us to train the neural network base on a set of training examples.
In order to accurately predict the HDI of a given area\comma{} the neural network must train on existing examples to see what makes a high HDI.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: User can select an area on the map for which they want to analyse
\textbf{Justification}: This will allow the user to choose which area they want to predict the HDI of by drawing on the map.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Neural Network accurately predicts HDI from those factors
\textbf{Justification}: Once the user has selected their area\comma{} the HDI must be predicted based on factors calculated from that area.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Changes are suggested to increase the HDI
\textbf{Justification}: This will allow the user to make an informed decision on what to do in order to improve their area.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Accurately calculate where a new building would need to be in order to increase the HDI the most
\textbf{Justification}: The specific placement of new buildings (as suggestions to increase HDI) is important to consider\comma{} so a suitable place must be chosen in order to decrease the average distance to it as much as possible.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: User can see how each factor can affect the others
\textbf{Justification}: This will allow the user to consider the secondary effects of their descisions\comma{} as the suggested changes may not only increase the HDI\comma{} but also some of the other factors.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: Predicted HDI is ranked among other countries with a similar HDI
\textbf{Justification}: This will allow users who are not that familiar with HDI to get an idea of the HDI scale by comparing it to the gist of what they know.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: App has a clean\comma{} simple and presentable GUI
\textbf{Justification}: This will make it easier for the user to use.

\textbf{Success Criterion}: App has been deployed on Hugging Face
\textbf{Justification}: This will allow anyone with a web browswer to use this app\comma{} without having to install anything.
